utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, y’know I was thinking of moving the couch over here.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why would you want to do that?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So that there will be a decent place for me to sit.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Rach, there is a decent place to…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And your lap does not count! Okay? Come on help me move this.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No. No. No.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No. Rosita does not move.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Rosita? As in…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: As in Rosita does not move.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, it’s just a chair! What’s the big deal?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: The big deal is that it is the exact equal distance from the bathroom to the kitchen and it’s at the perfect angle so you don’t get any glare coming of off Stevie.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Stevie the TV?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Is there a problem?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! Oh what does he know! Come on Rosita, us chichas got to stick together! You bitch!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, y’know what’s weird? After you guys get married, when you introduce me to people you’re gonna have to say, "This is my brother-in-law Ross." Not, "My friend Ross," "brother-in-law Ross." That’s weird isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Couldn’t I just say, "This is Ross?"

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sure, do whatever you want.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey Ross! So, I was checking out the uh, real estate section…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Look at this.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, it looks like mom and dad’s house. Oh, it even has a tree with a broken limb out front and the uh, the window in the attic is…Oh my God!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What? What happened to the window in the attic?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can’t believe mom and dad are selling the house!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I can’t believe they-they didn’t even tell us!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I can’t believe I still don’t know what happened to the window in the attic!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, hello dad! Monica and I just saw the house in the paper! Yes we’re surprised! Who did you leave a message with?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sorry!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, Joey I am so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I told you not to move it! Rach, how would you feel if say, I wanted to move you mom, and you said don’t, and I did it anyway and her head fell off?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, come on—Joey, I’ll buy you a new one! All right? We’ll go down to the store right now and we’ll-we’ll get you a new chair.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: She’s not even cold yet!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But don’t you think Rosita would’ve wanted you to move on? I mean y’know, she did always put…your comfort first.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s true.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay? You ready?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, I… I don’t want Stevie to see her like this.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I can’t believe we have to say goodbye to the house we grew up in. Man, some-some stranger’s gonna be living in my room.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, after 15 years of mom and dad keeping it as a shrine to you, it’s time the velvet ropes came down.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: They kept your room for a while.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh please! Dad turned my room into a gym 20 minutes after I moved out! I gotta say, a tanning bed and a stack of Victoria’s Secret catalogues, not a gym!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on, you know they love you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: As much as they love you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I was their first born! They thought she was barren! It’s not my fault.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ugh, I hate this year!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What’s wrong with this year?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well okay, it’s already February and I’ve only given two massages and they were both the worst tippers in the world!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That was me and Ross.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh that’s right!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, y’know if you want to pick up some extra cash? Some friends of mine made good money doing telemarketing.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh that’s a great idea. You’re really good on the phone.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah and yeah, and it would probably be better than the last telephone job I had. Y’know, I probably wouldn’t have to say spank as much.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh yeah, like you never called!

utterance.speaker: Supervisor
utterance.content: So basically this is very easy. You read from the script and try to sell as much toner as you possibly can.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, I can do that! Oh, by the way, I love my office.

utterance.speaker: Supervisor
utterance.content: Why don’t we do a trial run.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh okay. Umm, all right. Hi, this is Phoebe from Empire Office Supplies, can I speak to your supply manager please?

utterance.speaker: Supervisor
utterance.content: I’m the supply manager.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, okay I would like to talk to you about your toner needs.

utterance.speaker: Supervisor
utterance.content: We don’t need any toner.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh okay, well I’m sorry to bother you. Bye-bye. Yeah you’re right, this is easy.

utterance.speaker: Supervisor
utterance.content: Okay, what was wrong with that call?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh well, all right…um, no offense, but you were kind of rude.

utterance.speaker: Supervisor
utterance.content: They’re always going to tell you they don’t need toner, but that’s okay because whatever they say, you can find the answer to it here in this script.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Supervisor
utterance.content: So, I think you’re ready to sell toner, do you have any last questions?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No. Oh wait yes! I do, I do have one question. What is toner?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Joey! Joe! Full bag. Beer’s still cold. Something terrible must’ve happened here! Oh no-no-no-no-no-no! Stevie, I was never here!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Dad?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: I’m here!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Hi. God, it seems like just yesterday you guys used to come out to watch me work.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Dad, we-we can’t believe you’re selling the house.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Well, it’s time for a new family to start their memories here and hopefully their check will clear before they find the crack in the foundation and the asbestos in the ceiling.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Let’s grab our stuff and get the hell out of here.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: I’m sorry we can’t store your childhood things anymore.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, that’s okay, I can’t wait to see everything again! All of the memories…

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Well, I don’t know what’s in the boxes down here, but I do know there are six or seven Easy Bake Ovens in the attic.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I used to love to play restaurant.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, not as much as you used to love to play uncooked batter eater.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, it is unreasonable to expect a child to wait for a light bulb to cook brownies!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: So, I think you’re boxes are over here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wow! Great! Wait, dad who-who’s cigarettes are these?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: I don’t know. They-they must be your mother’s, but please, please don’t ask her. I’ll throw these away.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Cool! Dad! My report cards! Hey, check this out dad, Math, A. Science, A. History, A. Gym… Oooh, my rock polisher!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Oh look, look there’s your old makeup kit!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s a clown kit! Clown kit!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Well, the white seems to be untouched. Uh-oh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Y’know how the garage floods every Spring?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: How are you ever going to sell this place?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: I think I accidentally used Monica’s boxes to keep the water away from the Porsche.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh no. Dad! Dad! What… Oh God…everything’s ruined! Dad, she’s gonna be crushed!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: You don’t secretly smoke do you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: So it’s just your mother then.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi, this Phoebe from Empire Office Supplies, can I speak to your supply manager please? Earl, thanks. Hi Earl, this is Phoebe from Empire Office Supplies I’d like to talk to you about your toner needs.

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: I don’t need any toner.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m hearing what you’re saying, but at our prices everyone needs toner.

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Not me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: May I ask why?

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: You wanna know why. You wanna know why?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I surely do!

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Okay, I don’t need any toner because I’m going to kill myself.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, is-is that because you’re out of toner?

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Okay, so…no toner today. Thanks anyway, bye-bye.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No-no wait-wait! I can’t just let you hang up! Just please talk to me.

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Well…I only have one thing to do today. I guess I could push it back.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah! Now, why do you want to kill yourself?

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: It’s just that I uh, have been working for ten years now at this meaningless, dead-end job and nobody here even knows I exist!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Chandler?

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: I-I’m sorry?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No look, I-I’m sure that people know you exist!

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Oh yeah? I work in a cubicle surrounded by people. I’ve been talking to you for five minutes now about killing myself and no one’s even looked up from their desk. Hang-hang on. Hey everybody! Uh, I’m gonna kill myself! I’ll get back to ya. I got nothing. Wait. Uh, hey Marge! Ehh, nothing. Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: My chair. Now, if anybody asks, your name is Rosita!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You will like it!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No I won’t.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You don’t even know!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Because, I know what I like and what I don’t like! It’s not the same thing!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well look, if you don’t like this…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t know why you say that so soon.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Come on Joey, I just bought you a new chair! The most expensive one in the store! Hey, y’know what I was thinking? We could name her Francette.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Francette? What is she? A couch?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Poor thing. Cut down in her prime.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, the new chair will be here in an hour. Maybe we should actually move Rosita out of here. Y’know, start the heeling process?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, I guess you’re right. Maybe, maybe I’ll take her down to the incinerator. It’s gonna be so said, and kinda cool. She’s heeled!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That’s weird.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No it’s not weird, it’s a miracle!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It’s not a miracle Joey! I’m sure there’s some explanation.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh there is! If you want something enough and your heart is pure, wondrous things can happen!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, I really don’t…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Can you tell me how this happened?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well no.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Miracle!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, y’know what? Maybe somebody came in here and fixed it! Or something!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Someone like an…angel?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That’s right Joey, the chair angel came in and heeled your chair.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Get your non-believer ass outta my chair!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Well, she’ll understand right? It’s not like I did it on purpose.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Dad that won’t matter to her. Look, all my stuff is safe and dry and all her is-is, is growing new stuff! See, this is exactly the kind of thing that makes her think you guys love me more than you love her.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Oh my God, does she really thinks that?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, can you blame her?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Well I don’t know, I-I suppose we may have favored you unconsciously, you were a medical marvel! The doctor said your mother could…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Dad, dad I don’t want to hear about it.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, not right now. Okay look, Monica came here for some memories and damnit, we’re gonna give her some! Okay, grab…grab some empty boxes. Okay? We’ll-we’ll take stuff from mine and whatever we can pass off as hers we’ll-we’ll put ‘em in their.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Great!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Like uh y’know like this! This! She-she could’ve made this!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Sure!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Right? And this! She-she could’ve won this!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: This could’ve been hers!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sure! Ooh-ooh, what about this?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Your make-up kit? I’d feel better.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I am so psyched I kept this chair for myself!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, me too.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, how’s…how’s the uh, miracle chair?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah? Wow! Y’know, that this thing has speakers in the headrest!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No. Really?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah! You can hook it up to your TV and you get radio!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: My chair heels itself.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Earl, you’re not hearing me! All I’m saying is that you’re not alone all right? Everybody hates the people they work with!

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: Hey guy!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait, what was that? That sounded like someone being nice to you.

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: No! That’s just the "Hey Guy" guy. He says that to everybody! He’s the worst! I’d like to take him with me!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right so Earl, let’s just forget about the people at the office, okay? There-there’s gotta be someone else in your life worth sticking around for! What about-what about your family, your friends, or maybe your girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Yeah! Right!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh sorry, boyfriend!

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Oh no.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, whatever! Anything!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, he’s gotta go.

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Okay, I should, I should probably be getting back to my thing now. See ya.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! I’m not finished yet! Don’t! Don’t you dare hang up on me!!!

utterance.speaker: Supervisor
utterance.content: The new girl’s good.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey guys! Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, I just whipped us up some Easy Bake treats, they should be ready in about three days.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: That’s a good one! Do you hear that Ross? Three days!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah! Yeah! Oh, this will make a great memory.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. So, which boxes are mine?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, these. These are yours right here.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. Oh! A coloring book!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, oh you loved that thing. You always had it with you. You never went anywhere without-without that coloring book.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really? Wow! It looks like I had some trouble staying inside the lines.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Nu-uh!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, an old glove?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Oh, yeah you loved that glove! You took it every place you went. You never went any place without that glove.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow! Look at this! I can’t believe I even fit into this shirt! Oh, this is yours.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know how that got in there.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This isn’t mine. Hey, this isn’t, this isn’t my stuff! Ugh, Ross! These are your boxes! Where are my boxes?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Umm, your boxes are umm…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Dad?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Well, the garage flooded sweetie and it ruined everything in your boxes. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Just mine?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: I’m afraid so.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So why-why wasn’t Ross’s stuff ruined? And if you say the words medical marvel I’m going to Easy Bake your head!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Well, I used your boxes to divert water away from the Porsche.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So wait, Ross’s stuff is fine, but I have no memories because you wanted to keep the bottom two inches of your car away from water!!!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: There was also leaves and guk and stuff.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can’t believe this!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Screw it! I’m having one.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: How would you like to sit in a chair that fully reclines, has a rolling massage, and speakers in the head rest?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I’d love to but I’ve tried that so many times they won’t even let me in the store anymore.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well what if I told you, you can do it in my apartment?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Are you telling me that you bought the chair that is making all other lounge systems obsolete? The chair that Sit magazine called the Chair of the Year?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I just purchased the La-Z-Boy E-cliner 3000.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s awesome! That’s great! What made you do it?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, it’s a long story, but umm I broke Joey’s chair…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa-whoa! You broke Joey’s chair?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I thought I broke Joey’s chair! That’s why I replaced it with mine!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohhhhh. That’s how it got fixed!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, what did you think, that-that elves came in and fixed it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Noo! Angels.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m gettin’ my chair back!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? Wh-hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, it looks like it wasn’t heeled after all! Yeah! So, I guess this chair is mine now!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Joey you broke my chair!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Your chair?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, he thought he broke your chair so he switched the chairs!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So, there was no miracle?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No Joe, no miracle.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh no this is devastating! My faith is shaken. I’m so glad I have the new chair to get my through this difficult time in my life.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh-huh! Nice try, but you don’t get that chair anymore! All right? That is my chair now! You can sit on my lap! No I take that back!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I think I should get the chair!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How do you figure?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Because you broke a chair and you broke a chair! The only one around here that hasn’t broke a chair, is me!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No-no-no! This chair’s not going anywhere.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, where’s the logic in that?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: The logic is, that there are two of us and we are both strong enough to break a chair in half!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So Joey breaks my chair and I get nothing!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s right!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What are you guys? Like a gang or something?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! We are!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We’re the Cobras!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Excuse me! Can you tell me where I can find Earl? He’s the supply manager around here.

utterance.speaker: Marge
utterance.content: Sorry, I don’t know any Earl.

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: I’m right here!!!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Earl! I’m Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Phoebe? The lady who sells toner?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, look it, you-you can’t kill yourself.

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Look, um I really appreciate your coming down…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No-no I can’t! I can’t let you do it!

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Why?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Because it was fate that made me call you today!

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: I thought it was toner.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! Think about it okay? This isn’t even my regular job! Okay? And my first day on the job, you’re my first call! And-and somebody else might’ve hung up on you, but I wouldn’t do that because I know about this stuff. My mom killed herself.

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m not gonna give you tips! Look don’t you see that this-this…this all came together so that I could stop you from doing this.

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Couldn’t it just be a coincidence?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, it’s fate!

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: It doesn’t really seem like enough to be fate.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh. Well umm, okay here’s a weird thing. My mother was also a supply manager.

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: I’m actually the office manager.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God! So was she! And! Get this, okay? Your-your name is Earl, right? Her name was Pearl, P-Earl.

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Well, was there anything else?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Sure! Umm, where are you from?

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Philadelphia.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God! So was she! Oh, I’ve got-I’ve got goose bumps.

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, y’know I’m wearing layers and it’s warm.

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Yeah-yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But if—no look, okay. These jerks might not care about you, but the universe does! And that says a lot!

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Did you hear that?! I don’t need you guys to care about me! Because the universe cares! The whole universe! I really wished they’d care just a little bit though.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Y’know, I don’t-I don’t think it’s you. This is a freaky place. Hey! Guys! Oh no, it’s you.

utterance.speaker: Earl
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, this terrible! Everything is destroyed! Look at this. It obviously meant enough for me to save it, and I don’t even know what it is! Ohh, it’s still soft. What do you think this is?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right. I think it was a mouse.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: How are you honey?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How do you think I am?! You’ve wrecked all my childhood memories. You love Ross more than me. And I just rubbed a dead mouse on my face!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Sweetheart, we love you just as much as Ross! Now, I’m sorry about everything that happened and I’d probably never be able to make it up to you, but here’s a start.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What’s this?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: It’s the key to my Porsche. Well, the key to your Porsche.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?!!!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: I’ve been thinking about getting rid of it. I was driving it the other day and saw my reflection in a store window. Your mother’s right, I do look like an ass.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait, you’re giving me your Porsche, you’re kidding me right?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well w-w-w-w-wait, w-wait, wait, wait a minute! I mean a couple of stupid boxes get wet and she gets a Porsche?!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Why don’t we take it for a spin?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, what about me?! I’m a medical marvel!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ahhhh….

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ahhh…… Eh?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey guys!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Do you guys know what happened to Chandler’s barca lounger?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah, Joey broke it. Had to get rid of it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are you kidding?! I get a Porsche and the barca lounger’s gone?! This is the best day ever!
